Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Mj-sty (natural AMPs; shrimp, crustaceans, arthropods, invertebrate, animals;)

Literature Information.Literature: APD analysis reveals that the sequence of THE PEPTIDE most resembles (53.8%)Ls-Stylicin1. 18 prolines at the N-terminal domain and 13 Cys at the C-terminus. It is expressed in all tissues: highest in gills and hemocytes. Mj-sty is potentially involved in the ontogenesis and immune responses to white spot syndrome virus (WSSV).
Literature Information.Author: Liu HT, Wang J, Mao Y, Liu M, Niu SF, Qiao Y, Su YQ, Wang CZ, Zheng ZP.2015
Literature Information.Title: Identification and expression analysis of a novel stylicin antimicrobial peptide from Kuruma shrimp (Marsupenaeus japonicus).
